title: SixDegrees
overview: SixDegrees.com launches as one of the first social networking sites, allowing users to create profiles and connect with friends online.

title: Friendster
overview: Friendster launches and popularizes the idea of a modern online social network, influencing future platforms like MySpace and Facebook.

title: MySpace
overview: MySpace becomes the largest social network in the mid-2000s, known for customizable profiles and music sharing, especially among youth culture.

title: Facebook
overview: Mark Zuckerberg and co-founders launch Facebook at Harvard, which grows into the worldâ€™s largest social media platform.

title: Twitter
overview: Twitter launches as a microblogging platform with 140-character posts, later becoming a central hub for news, politics, and real-time conversations.

title: Instagram
overview: Instagram debuts as a photo-sharing app, quickly growing with its mobile-first design, filters, and later Stories feature.

title: Snapchat
overview: Snapchat introduces disappearing photos and videos, pioneering ephemeral messaging and augmented reality lenses.

title: TikTok
overview: TikTok launches internationally, popularizing short-form video with an algorithmic feed, reshaping online content creation and consumption.

title: Clubhouse
overview: Clubhouse gains popularity during the COVID-19 pandemic as an audio-only social platform, showcasing the rise of live voice interaction.
